content.question: A collision experiment is conducted using two blocks, Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, that can slide with negligible friction along a horizontal surface. Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is initially moving with speed <math alttext="v sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> toward Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, which has a mass <math alttext="m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and is initially at rest, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The blocks collide, and after the collision they stick together and move with speed <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. In multiple trials of this experiment, Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is given different initial velocities. Data for <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> as a function of <math alttext="v sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> are recorded, and the data is used to make a best-fit curve, which is a straight line as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. If the experiment were repeated with Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> replaced by a block of mass <math alttext="2 m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, how would the best-fit line to the data change, if at all?

choices.label: The slope of the line would be less.
The slope of the line would be greater.
The line would become a curve with a slope that is not constant.

content.answer: The slope of the line would be greater.
